# How to Use Element 3D Plugin for After Effects for Free
 
Element 3D is a powerful plugin for Adobe After Effects that allows you to create stunning 3D graphics and animations with ease. However, it is not a cheap plugin, and it requires a license to use it. If you want to try Element 3D for free, there are some ways to do it legally and safely.

In this article, we will show you how to use Element 3D plugin for After Effects for free for 19 days, without breaking any laws or risking your computer's security. Here are the steps you need to follow:
 
1. Download and install the trial version of Element 3D from the official website: [https://www.videocopilot.net/products/element2/](https://www.videocopilot.net/products/element2/). The trial version is fully functional and has no limitations, except that it expires after 14 days.
2. Launch After Effects and create a new composition. Then, go to Layer > New > Solid and create a solid layer of any color.
3. Go to Effect > Video Copilot > Element and apply the Element 3D effect to the solid layer. You will see a dialog box asking you to enter your license information. Click on "Request File" and save the license request file to your computer.
4. Go to [https://www.videocopilot.net/purchase/element/](https://www.videocopilot.net/purchase/element/) and click on "Generate License". Upload the license request file that you saved in the previous step and enter your email address. You will receive an email with a link to download your license file.
5. Go back to After Effects and click on "Install License File" in the Element 3D dialog box. Browse to the license file that you downloaded from the email and click on "Open". You will see a message saying that your license has been installed successfully.
6. Congratulations! You can now use Element 3D plugin for After Effects for free for 14 days. You can access the plugin's interface by clicking on "Scene Setup" in the Effect Controls panel. You can also import 3D models, materials, lights, cameras, and animations from the plugin's library or from your own files.
7. If you want to extend your trial period for another 5 days, you can do so by following these steps:
    1. Before your trial expires, go to [https://www.videocopilot.net/support/updates/](https://www.videocopilot.net/support/updates/) and download the latest update for Element 3D. Make sure you download the correct version for your operating system and After Effects version.
    2. Uninstall Element 3D from your computer by going to Control Panel > Programs and Features (Windows) or Applications > Element 3D (Mac) and deleting the plugin folder.
    3. Install the update that you downloaded in the previous step by running the installer file and following the instructions.
    4. Repeat steps 2-6 from above to activate your new trial license. You will get another 14 days of free use, but only 5 of them will be valid, since the trial period is counted from the first activation date.
